graph.title: Get Revenue Data
graph.content: <1195>[Get Revenue Data] Extract the 2018 revenue of the identified company from the data.</1195>
graph.answer:
To identify the Nordic company with more employees than Securitas and extract its 2018 revenue, we first note that Securitas has approximately 300,000 employees. We will compare this number with the employee counts of the companies listed in the provided data.

From the data:
- ISS: 500,000 employees (2018)
- A.P. Møller-Maersk: 80,220 employees (2018)
- Nokia: 103,000 employees (2018)
- Ericsson: 95,000 employees (2018)
- Volvo: 570,000 employees (2018)
- H&M: 132,000 employees (2018)
- Electrolux: 64,874 employees (2018)
- Sandvik: 42,000 employees (2018)
- Skanska: 52,557 employees (2018)

From this comparison, the companies with more employees than Securitas are:
1. ISS: 500,000 employees
2. Volvo: 570,000 employees

Next, we extract the 2018 revenue for these companies:
- ISS: DKK 73.5 billion
- A.P. Møller-Maersk: US $39 billion
- Nokia: €23 billion
- Ericsson: (not provided)
- Volvo: (not provided)
- H&M: (not provided)
- Electrolux: (not provided)
- Sandvik: 91 billion SEK
- Skanska: (not provided)

Since the task specifies to extract the revenue of the identified company, we focus on the companies with more employees than Securitas. The revenues for ISS and A.P. Møller-Maersk are available, while the revenues for Volvo and others are not specified in the provided data.

Thus, the relevant revenues extracted are:
- ISS: DKK 73.5 billion
- A.P. Møller-Maersk: US $39 billion

Both companies qualify based on employee count, but since the task requires focusing on the company with more employees than Securitas, we will prioritize ISS due to its higher employee count.
